Office Supt.
Corsicana Tex. April 28th 1884

My Dear Professor:

Contrary to my custom
I have delayed a reply to your
welcome letter quite a long time.
This long silence has been brought
about by press of business & burden
of responsibility which at times
seems almost crushing.
Our teaching force - at all times
inadequate in number - has
been interrupted from time
to time & in that few weeks
I have been forced to "box
the compass" - in the scale of
teaching - from the abecedarian
to the High School.

Our teacher absent this week –

[1884, April 28] Nay I should be inclined to accept - but I can engage in no "Scramble for Office". I appreciate most highly your Kind wishes & solicitation. Inter nos sub rosa I would be glad to accept the position of Greek or Latin Chair in University or the Chair of English in A. M. C. but will never raise my finger to unsettle any one. I have felt better than usual for some days past. Prof. H. has been heard from at Austin & San Antonio. Some "Project". Please write me a long letter at once Will you go to San Antonio in Jan? Please excuse haste - I can & will do better next time. Present me kindly to Mrs. M. Your friend J T Hand
